other_tests.findings: Demonstrated a vascular proliferation with prominent plump endothelial cells and nodular lymphocytic infiltrates with numerous eosinophils, consistent with angiolymphoid hyperplasia with eosinophilia (ALHE).

Revealed a fistula with direct arteriovenous shunting and early venous drainage overlying the posterior scalp supplied via branches of the right superficial temporal artery and bilateral occipital arteries.
Performed to control the AV shunting.
other_tests.changes_over_time: One week follow-up revealed regression of the non-excised areas and resolution of pruritus.

other_tests.findings: Indicated severe sensorimotor peripheral neuropathy with demyelination and axonal loss.
Showed a small amount of dermal amyloid deposition and extravasated red blood cells.
Showed extensive amyloid deposition throughout the submucosa, within peripheral nerve fibers and around minor salivary gland ducts.
